articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli lawmakers passed two laws on Monday that could threaten the work of the main U.N.
articles.title: Israel passes laws to restrict the work of a UN agency that is a lifeline for Gaza

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON and DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democrats stepped up their attacks on Donald Trump on Monday, a day after a comedian opening a rally for the former president called Puerto Rico a “floating island of garbage,” a comment that drew wide condemnation and highlighted the rising power of a key Latino group in the swing state of Pennsylvania.
articles.title: Democrats escalate attacks on Trump after comedian calls Puerto Rico 'floating island of garbage'

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — A comic calling Puerto Rico garbage before a packed Donald Trump rally in New York was the latest humiliation for an island territory that has long suffered from mistreatment, residents said Monday in expressions of fury that could affect the presidential election.
articles.title: Americans in Puerto Rico can't vote for US president. Their anger at Trump is shaping the race

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE, MARYCLAIRE DALE and CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — Kamala Harris said Sunday that “no one can sit on the sidelines” in this year's presidential election, capping a day of campaigning across the largest city in the crucial battleground state of Pennsylvania.
articles.title: Harris rallies Philadelphia voters at church, barbershop, bookstore, restaurant and basketball court

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump hosted a rally featuring crude and racist insults at New York’s Madison Square Garden, turning what his campaign had dubbed as the event where he would deliver his closing message into an illustration of what turns off his critics.
articles.title: Trump's Madison Square Garden event features crude and racist insults

articles.author: GARY FIELDS, ALI SWENSON and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — American voters are approaching the presidential election with deep unease about what could follow, including the potential for political violence, attempts to overturn the election results and its broader implications for democracy, according to a new poll.
articles.title: US voters concerned about post-election violence and efforts to overturn the results: AP-NORC poll

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and MIKE PESOLI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Polarizing. Challenging. A lot of wasted time. That’s how six lawmakers described what it is like being in the U.S.
articles.title: In their own words: What it's like in a 'chaos' Congress and why these lawmakers keep coming back

articles.author: SARAH PARVINI
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — McDonald’s announced Sunday that Quarter Pounders will again be on its menu at hundreds of its restaurants after testing ruled out beef patties as the source of the outbreak of E.
articles.title: McDonald’s Quarter Pounder back on the menu after testing rules out beef patties as E. coli source

articles.author: LORNE COOK and TARA COPP
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — North Korea has sent about 10,000 troops to Russia to train and fight in Ukraine within “the next several weeks,” the Pentagon said Monday, in a move that Western leaders say will intensify the almost three-year war and jolt relations in the Indo-Pacific region.
articles.title: North Korea has sent about 10,000 troops to Russia to fight in Ukraine, Pentagon says

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Tens of thousands of Georgians massed outside parliament Monday night, demanding the annulment of the weekend parliamentary election that the president has alleged was rigged with the help of Russia.
articles.title: Tens of thousands rally in Georgia to denounce the parliamentary election they say was rigged
